definition: to spend a great deal of time and effort/(of a task) demanding/exacting
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
to travel far and wide looking for sth, only to find it easily
pinyin: ta4 po4 tie3 xie2 wu2 mi4 chu4 , de2 lai2 quan2 bu4 fei4 gong1 fu5
containing_words.word: 踏破鐵鞋無覓處，得來全不費工夫

sentences.english: Because after each use environmental protection bags are cleaning, gardening takes more bother than.
sentences.chinese: 因爲環保袋每次用完都要清洗，很費工夫。

sentences.english: Don't bother about meditation and concentration.
sentences.chinese: 不要費工夫在冥想和專注的問題上了。

sentences.english: Listening to the words to songs that you never bothered listening to before.
sentences.chinese: 聼那些你以前從不願爲此枉費工夫的歌詞。
